summary: Teacher: I've finished marking your homework from yesterday's class, but I noticed one student forgot to write their name on...
body:
Teacher: I’ve finished marking your homework from yesterday’s class, but I noticed one student forgot to write their name on their paper …

Teacher: Whoever they are wrote in green pen, has rather messy handwriting, and covered the entire paper with little drawings of muffins, swingsets, a boy doing what appears to be a somersault while another cheers him on, two guys sharing a milkshake, the same two guys getting married at a park and what seems to be challah.

Teacher: Does anyone know who this belongs to?

*The entire class turns to look at TJ*

TJ: What? Why’s everyone looking at me?? That could belong to anyone!

Teacher: It also appears to have the words “Mr. Goodman” and a giant heart that says “TK + CG” doodled at the bottom right corner.

TJ, raising his hand: Oh yeah, that’s mine.

question: Platonic! Tuffy headcanons?
answer:
send me headcanon prompts

- They have weekly meetings at The Spoon to help each other with basketball strategy for their teams.

- TJ starts joining Buffy and Marty on their runs, Marty is truly terrified by how much more competitive Buffy gets when TJ is around

- When Buffy’s dad is out at work and the house gets too quiet she starts going over to TJ’s to hang - it’s starts because one weekend Andi and Cyrus were both busy with family things and Marty wasn’t around so she went to challenge TJ to some H.O.R.S.E and it just turned into them playing video games and trash talking each other at his house instead

- Every time Buffy sees a shirt with something basketball related on it at the mall she sends a picture to TJ. She is responsible for 90% of his terrible shirt collection.

- TJ makes a playlist for working out and Buffy makes him share it with her and it’s become their way of bonding over music

- Most of their friendship I constructed around a shared love of sports but sometimes they have genuinely deep conversations about feelings even if they like to pretend that’s not the case

- They both know they have each other’s backs and at school if anyone makes any negative comments about either of them the other will most stick up for them

summary: I still think Marty is a better and more suitable person for Buffy than Walker tho, I think the writers pairing Buffy with...
question: I still think Marty is a better and more suitable person for Buffy than Walker tho, I think the writers pairing Buffy with Walker was a huge mistake on their part, they have nothing in common and we didn’t even see how her crush on him developed not how their relationship was. I think pairing Buffy with one of her basketball teammates would have been a better option and would have saved time till Marty came back.
answer:
Yes, of course Muffy is a better written storyline than Wuffy, but that’s not hard to do 😂

Honestly, her having a crush on Mr. “Pass her the ball, Kippen!”, the basketball extra with lines who always supported Buffy, would make more sense than Wuffy

reblog.comment:
Yes, of course Muffy is a better written storyline than Wuffy, but that’s not hard to do 😂

Honestly, her having a crush on Mr. “Pass her the ball, Kippen!”, the basketball extra with lines who always supported Buffy, would make more sense than Wuffy

summary:
Young Kippen siblings 
TJ went to all of Amber’s dance competitions. Although he pretended to be disinterested, he was...
body:
Young Kippen siblings

  • TJ went to all of Amber’s dance competitions. Although he pretended to be disinterested, he was fascinated with the world of dance.
  • Amber went to all of TJ’s baseball games, (but sometimes when the games were slow, she left to do cartwheels behind the bleachers). But she’d always be back in time to give him at high five at the end of the game.
  • They shared a room until their older sister moved out. Although they complained about it all the time, they secretly loved it.
  • When ever their parents were fighting they would look through old family photo albums. Their favorite photo was one of Amber giving TJ a piggyback ride around their grandparents’ backyard.

  • When ever their parents were fighting they would look through old family photo albums. Their favorite photo was one of Amber giving TJ a piggyback ride around their grandparents’ backyard.

  • They shared a room until their older sister moved out. Although they complained about it all the time, they secretly loved it.
  • When ever their parents were fighting they would look through old family photo albums. Their favorite photo was one of Amber giving TJ a piggyback ride around their grandparents’ backyard.

summary: We really going to go from Andi being so not into the idea of dating Jonah that she gets a terrified look on her face and...
body: We really going to go from Andi being so not into the idea of dating Jonah that she gets a terrified look on her face and immediately says “NOPE, not it. Mack out.” at the mere suggestion of them getting back together…and Jonah being back with Amber…and still not having sought out professional help for his mental health, to Jonah singing (again) to get Andi back and it actually working ??? That’s…what? 6 episodes (7 if you count the episode itself) in between now and the assumed Singing Related Grand Gesture™ in 3x20. Terri Minsky and Co. really got some heavy lifting to do on this one.

blog.name: disneymack
blog.title: andi mack trash
blog.description:
sadie. 23. she/they. lesbian. here to talk about tv & give advice. hoodie enthusiast. fandom mother.

main blog & twitter: sadieannerue instagram: dailymackcast, andimackpapercraneproject

summary: Ew, no. I do not want or need T.J. rapping my boi Cyrus an apology and then him just completely ignoring it. Nope-ity-nope!
question: Ew, no. I do not want or need T.J. rapping my boi Cyrus an apology and then him just completely ignoring it. Nope-ity-nope!
answer:
I didn’t say that Cyrus should “completely ignore it”. I said that he should call TJ out for handling the apology in that way because it doesn’t make sense with their relationship to one another. 

I don’t want or need TJ rapping on the show again, period. But if they’re gonna go that route, I think it would be better from a storytelling perspective to show Cyrus not automatically accept it, and to show Cyrus demand the sincere and sentimental apology he deserves. It would really complete the overlapping character development and relationship development between TJ and Cyrus. Because it would be TJ essentially giving Cyrus that final push to stand up for himself and demand what he deserves. And at the same time it would be Cyrus giving TJ that final push to be vulnerable and open and honest. And it would ultimately result in them getting together as well. So like… it would be a very good way to wrap up their story. 

If I gotta sit through another cringey rap, I want it to at least be handled in a way where Cyrus is just as disappointed by it as I will be ok lmao. Also it was just a hc so who cares, it’s not like I’m writing the show.

If I gotta sit through another cringey rap, I want it to at least be handled in a way where Cyrus is just as disappointed by it as I will be ok lmao. Also it was just a hc so who cares, it’s not like I’m writing the show.
trail.content:
I didn’t say that Cyrus should “completely ignore it”. I said that he should call TJ out for handling the apology in that way because it doesn’t make sense with their relationship to one another. 

I don’t want or need TJ rapping on the show again, period. But if they’re gonna go that route, I think it would be better from a storytelling perspective to show Cyrus not automatically accept it, and to show Cyrus demand the sincere and sentimental apology he deserves. It would really complete the overlapping character development and relationship development between TJ and Cyrus. Because it would be TJ essentially giving Cyrus that final push to stand up for himself and demand what he deserves. And at the same time it would be Cyrus giving TJ that final push to be vulnerable and open and honest. And it would ultimately result in them getting together as well. So like… it would be a very good way to wrap up their story. 

If I gotta sit through another cringey rap, I want it to at least be handled in a way where Cyrus is just as disappointed by it as I will be ok lmao. Also it was just a hc so who cares, it’s not like I’m writing the show.

summary: How long do you think we could go with this characters / story? Like how old is too old for all the characters to keep being...
question: How long do you think we could go with this characters / story? Like how old is too old for all the characters to keep being characters on a disney show? And if we get a season 4 on disney channel, do you think theennn there could actually be a chance for them to move the series to disney + (in the case they decided to keep going with the series)?
answer:
In theory, I think the characters and stories could continue until the end of high school if they wanted to. We have seen a lot of Disney Channel’s shows make it to that point without having to become too inappropriate for Disney Channel, and I think there would still be ways to do that for Andi Mack if they wanted to. And I think it would be smart of Disney Channel to do something like that, because they aren’t making series that have lasting impact anymore like Boy Meets World or That’s So Raven, which lead them to be able to do the spin-offs they have been doing recently. None of their original shows in the past few years have lasted long enough or made a big enough impression on audiences to still be relevant in 10 years - except for Andi Mack tbh. It’s the only thing they’ve got with potential to be timeless.

I think it would have a better chance of being successful if they moved it over to Disney+ as we all know, but it would still be a Disney show. I’m not sure if anyone would actually be interested in the show lasting that long, but from a storytelling perspective I think it would be possible.

If they decide to renew the series, I think there would be a chance of it being moved to Disney+ but that’s just because it seems like such an obvious choice to me. I have no idea what is actually going on behind the scenes at Disney so I can’t really know the likelihood of that lol.
